questions.q: What is the contrapositive of 'If it rains, then the grass is wet'?
questions.explanation: The contrapositive of 'if p then q' is 'if not q then not p'. Therefore, 'If the grass is not wet, then it does not rain'.
options: If the grass is wet, then it rains
If it doesn't rain, then the grass is not wet
If the grass is not wet, then it doesn't rain
If it rains, then the grass is not wet

questions.q: What is the negation of the statement 'All cats are black'?
questions.explanation: The negation of a universal statement (All) is an existential statement (Some ... not).
options: No cats are black
Some cats are black
Some cats are not black
All cats are not black

questions.q: Let P(x) be 'x is a prime number' and Q(x) be 'x is odd.' Which statement represents 'All prime numbers except 2 are odd'?
questions.explanation: The expression targets all x that are both prime and not equal to 2.
options: For all x(P(x) implies Q(x))
For all x(P(x) and Q(x))
For all x(P(x) implies Q(x)) or x=2
For all x((P(x) and x is not 2) implies Q(x))

questions.q: Which of these statements about logical equivalences is FALSE?
questions.explanation: Implication is not associative; changing the grouping changes the meaning of the statement.
options: p implies q is equivalent to not p or q
not(p implies q) is equivalent to p and not q
p implies q is equivalent to not q implies not p
p implies (q implies r) is equivalent to (p implies q) implies r

questions.q: If P(x) means 'x is a dog' and Q(x) means 'x has four legs', which statement means 'All dogs have four legs'?
questions.explanation: Universal statements regarding properties are represented as 'For all x, if x is P, then x is Q'.
options: There exists an x such that (P(x) and Q(x))
For all x(P(x) and Q(x))
For all x(P(x) implies Q(x))
There exists an x such that (P(x) implies Q(x))

questions.q: If P(x) means 'x is a student' and Q(x) means 'x studies hard', what does 'There exists an x such that (P(x) and Q(x))' mean in English?
questions.explanation: The existential quantifier translates to 'There exists' or 'Some'.
options: All students study hard
Some students study hard
No students study hard
All students don't study hard

questions.q: Let P(x,y) mean 'x is greater than y'. What is the meaning of 'For all x, there exists a y such that P(x,y)'?
questions.explanation: This means that for every chosen x, you can find at least one y that is smaller than it.
options: For every x, there is some y that is greater than x
For every x, there is some y that x is greater than
There exists an x that is greater than all y
There exists a y that is greater than all x

questions.q: The contrapositive of 'If n is even, then n squared is even' is:
questions.explanation: We negate and swap both sides: 'If n squared is not even, then n is not even'.
options: If n is odd, then n squared is odd
If n squared is odd, then n is odd
If n is not even, then n squared is not even
If n squared is not even, then n is not even

questions.q: What is the symbolic form of 'Not all doctors work in hospitals'?
questions.explanation: Saying 'Not all' is logically the same as saying 'There is at least one that is not'.
options: For all x(Doctor(x) implies not Hospital(x))
There exists an x such that (Doctor(x) and not Hospital(x))
It is not the case that for all x(Doctor(x) implies Hospital(x))
Both B and C

questions.q: If C(x) means 'x is a car' and F(x) means 'x is fast', which symbolizes 'Only fast vehicles are cars'?
questions.explanation: The phrase 'Only B are A' means that if something is an A, it must be a B.
options: For all x(Car(x) implies Fast(x))
For all x(Fast(x) implies Car(x))
For all x(Car(x) if and only if Fast(x))
There exists an x such that (Car(x) and Fast(x))

questions.q: If f(x) = x cubed minus 3x and g(x) = x + 2, then (f composed with g)(1) equals:
questions.explanation: First find g(1) = 3. Then find f(3) = 3 cubed (27) minus 3 times 3 (9), which equals 18.

questions.q: For which function is the inverse of f equal to f?
questions.explanation: A function that is its own inverse is an involution. For f(x)=1/x, f(f(x)) = 1/(1/x) = x.
options: f(x) = x squared
f(x) = x

questions.q: The power set of {a, b} contains:
questions.explanation: The number of elements in a power set is 2 raised to the power of the number of elements in the set. 2 squared is 4.
options: 2 elements
3 elements
4 elements
5 elements

questions.q: Let A = {1, 2, 3} and B = {2, 3, 4}. What is (A minus B) union (B minus A)?
questions.explanation: A minus B leaves {1}. B minus A leaves {4}. Combining them gives {1, 4}.
options: Empty Set
